conclusion: To determine which car, Car A or Car B, has the greater acceleration, we need to analyze the graph of their velocity squared versus displacement.
The x-axis represents the displacement (in meters).
The y-axis represents the velocity squared (in meters per square second squared).
Line A is the graph for Car A.
Line B is the graph for Car B.
The slope of a line on a graph represents the rate of change of the dependent variable (velocity squared) with respect to the independent variable (displacement).

premise: The slope of a line on a graph represents the rate of change of the dependent variable (velocity squared) with respect to the independent variable (displacement).
conclusion: For Line A (Car A), the slope is calculated as the change in velocity squared divided by the change in displacement.
